author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Quick API call lesson
summary: For all those in a hackathon rush, this is a quick rundown on how to use the Yelp API and then prototype it with Insomnia, and then generate the code for you to use.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Write and Host a Website
summary: You've been working hard on honing your web-dev skills and are ready for the world to see. Let's find out how to deploy our HTML code on Github Pages for free so that anyone connected to the internet can see our website that we've made.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Using Fonts in your Website
summary: Learn how to find, import, and use various fonts to make your site unique. First, I'll give you a quick 5 minute how-to if you're pressed for time (like a hackathon) and if you're interested, I'll tell you some other tips and tricks to make you a font-master

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Using UI libraries in HTML/CSS/JS
summary: Designing and developing custom web components is challenging. Let's learn how to utilize prebuilt UI libraries to supercharge our projects

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Flask Quickstart (for hackathons)
summary: A quickstart tutorial into using Flask. Meant to be short and to the point with a quick barebones starter code boilerplate to get you running asap.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Introduction to API Calls
summary: An intro to API calls. Expand your ability to create powerful applications by utilizing large datasets and other functionalities.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Creating your first React project
summary: A continuation on Starting out with React, this is the second part of a workshop series for HackUCI.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Starting out with React
summary: An intro to React. We'll be drawing comparisons to how we would normally write code in vanilla javascript and see how it's simpler in React.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Setting up React
summary: A quick start on how to set up React for coding.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Designing a URL shortener
summary: You might have heard of services like Bit.ly or TinyURL and wondered, how are these URL shorteners made? We'll explore the designs of these systems and then code our own.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Intro to Web Dev
summary: Assuming you have no experience with web development, we investigate the languages that make up the web and analyze a basic sample

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Learning about HTTP requests
summary: Here, we will take a look at how we are using HTTP requests whenever we browse the internet. Then, we can take a look at API's and how we can utilize http requests to call them and test them.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Starting out with Flask
summary: Explore the Flask framework for Python and understand when we should use it. Then, we'll run our own Flask app in under 8 lines of code. Finally, we'll take look at the various use cases of Flask and you can decide which way you would prefer to use it.

author: Ryan Yang
https://ryqn.dev
title: Making a dark / light mode theme switcher
summary: Learn how to setup a theme toggler with just CSS and Javascript. We'll be using CSS variables and utilizing Javascript functions to swap out styles. Then, we'll use Local Storage to save the theme and load it in future use.
